metadata.Title: CVE-2022-34265 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Compliant (bionic) - medium.
metadata.Description:
An issue was discovered in Django 3.2 before 3.2.14 and 4.0 before 4.0.6. The Trunc() and Extract() database functions are subject to SQL injection if untrusted data is used as a kind/lookup_name value. Applications that constrain the lookup name and kind choice to a known safe list are unaffected.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-34265` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

python-django - 1:1.11.11-1ubuntu1.18
python-django-common - 1:1.11.11-1ubuntu1.18
python3-django - 1:1.11.11-1ubuntu1.18
No subscription required

notes.Note: alexmurray> original advisory only lists 3.2.x and 4.x as affected but looks like 1.11.x as used in bionic and 2.2.x as used in focal/impish are also likely vulnerable too

criterions.comment: python-django package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:1.11.11-1ubuntu1.18').
